application_type_full: Approval of details reserved by a condition (discharge)
description: Demolition of workshop within car dealership and existing valet building together with extensions, additions and alterations to car dealership including; enlargement of the building with reconfigured internal layout; new cladding, fenestration, pedestrian and vehicle doors; new third storey and car decks; vehicular access ramp; reconfigured surface parking and vehicle display area; and associated landscaping and infrastructure works (AMENDED PLANS).

Condition : 3 - No demolition of construction work shall take place on the site except between the hours of 8am to 6pm Mondays to Fridays and 8am to 1pm on Saturdays and none shall take place on Sundays and public holidays without the prior agreement of the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - Prior to first occupation, a Delivery and Servicing Management Plan shall be submitted to
and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The Plan shall include details of
delivery and service vehicles on-site, vehicle tracking, delivery hours and protocols for
delivery and servicing outside the AM and PM peak hours. Works shall be carried out in
accordance with the agreed Plan.
Condition : 5 - Development shall be carried out in accordance with the submitted Travel Plan.

Condition : 6 - Prior to the first occupation of the building, a Parking Design and Management Plan shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The Plan shall ensure that the initial level of customer parking spaces is limited to thirty-nine spaces, as well as details of the monitoring of customer spaces in order to support any future increases of onsite parking to a maximum level of fifty-seven customer parking spaces, and details of EV charging infrastructure. Monitoring and works shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and the requirements of the approved travel plan (including any recommendations arising from the results of monitoring).

Condition : 7 - A splay of 2.4m x 2.4m shall be provided on each side of all of the accesses, the depth measured from the back of the footway and the widths outwards from the edges of the access, and no fence, wall or other obstruction to visibility exceeding 0.6m in height above the surface of the adjoining highway shall be erected within the areas of such splays.

Condition : 8 - Prior to first occupation of the building, full details of the works to the access on Great West
Road shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority, in
consultation with Transport for London. Prior to occupation of the building, the applicant shall
have entered into a highways agreement with TfL to carry out, complete and retain the
approved works to the access on the Great West Road.

Condition : 10 - Prior to first occupation of the building(s) evidence (e.g. photographs, installation contracts and As-Built certificates under the National Calculation Method shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority and approved in writing to show that the development has been constructed in accordance with the approved Energy Strategy, and any subsequent approved revisions.

Condition : 11 - A)	Within three months of work starting on site, a BREEAM Design Stage certificate and summary score sheet (or such equivalent standard that replaces this) must be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority to show that an 'Excellent' (minimum score 70%) rating will be achieved, and;
B)	Within six months of first occupation of the building a BREEAM Post-Construction Review certificate and summary score sheet (or such equivalent standard that replaces this) must be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority to show that an 'Excellent' (minimum score 70%) rating has been achieved.

Condition : 12 - Prior to first occupation of the building, full details of cycle parking showing the type of cycle
parking proposed shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning
Authority. The cycle parking shall be implemented and maintained as approved prior to the
occupation of the development.

Condition : 13 - a.)	The Local Planning Authority shall be notified immediately if additional contamination is discovered during the course of the development. A competent person shall assess the additional contamination, and shall submit appropriate amendments to the scheme for decontamination in writing to the Local Planning Authority for approval before any work on that aspect of development continues.  
b.)	The agreed scheme for decontamination outlined in the Remediation Method Statement, shall be fully implemented and a written validation (closure) report submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval prior to the occupation of the building.

Condition : 14 - The level of noise emitted from any new plant or machinery associated with the commercial use shall be lower than the existing background level by at least 10 dB(A). Noise levels shall be determined at one metre external from the window of the nearest noise sensitive premises. The measurements and assessment shall be made in accordance to BS4142:2014.

Condition : 15 - The external lighting shall be in accordance with drawing numbers:  18.028/E/40 Rev P0,18.028/E/41 Rev P0 and 18.028/E/02 Rev P3 and reports: 18.029 Mercedes-Benz Brentford _External Lighting _Car Park_Deck 1_190610, 18.029 Mercedes-Benz Brentford _External Lighting _Car Park_Deck 2_190610, and 18.029 Mercedes-Benz Brentford _External Lighting _Roof Deck CarPark_190606 and hereby approved. The external lighting shall be turned off between the hours of 10pm and 6am unless agreed otherwise in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 16 - Prior to first use of the building, full details of both hard and soft landscape works have been submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority and these works shall be carried out as approved. These details shall include (proposed finished levels or contours; means of enclosure; car parking layouts; other vehicle and pedestrian access and circulation areas; hard surfacing material; minor artefacts and structures (eg. furniture, play equipment, refuse or other storage units, signs, lighting etc); proposed and existing functional services above and below ground (eg drainage power, communications cables, pipelines etc. indicating lines, manholes, supports etc); retained historic landscape features and proposals for restoration, where relevant). Soft landscape works shall include (planting plans; written specifications (including cultivation and other operations associated with plant and grass establishment); schedules of plants, noting species, plant sizes and proposed numbers/densities where appropriate; implementation programme).

Condition : 17 - The use hereby permitted shall not be carried on outside the following times: 7.00am to 7.00pm Monday to Friday, 7.30am to 5.00pm on Saturdays and 9.00am to 4.00pm on Sundays and Bank Holidays.

Condition : 18 - Prior to the commencement of the above ground works (excluding site investigations and demolition) final detailed drainage designs (including drawings) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. These details shall include the greenfield runoff rate with supporting calculations, MicroDrainage calculations, and a maintenance plan. The works shall be carried out as approved prior to commencement of operations.

Condition : 19 - Prior to the commencement of the use hereby approved details to demonstrate that the drainage scheme has been implemented shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.
